description: Music video featuring art, direction and animation by Kawasemi for the song FASTENING by Zutomayo.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/zutomayo)

ACA-NE, alternatively pronounced as Akane, is a Japanese vocalist, lyricist, composer and member of the rock band [Zutomayo](https://anilist.co/staff/170315/ZUTOMAYO).

__[Website](https://zutomayo.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/zutomayo_staff) | [Instagram (run by ACA-NE)](https://www.instagram.com/zutomayo/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCv6P5nsS9rP4tDtFlqLU_QQ) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/38WbKH6oKAZskBhqDFA8Uj?si=5bjHWeOJTmKT7BgIOkRdJA)__

__Introduction:__
Zutto Mayonaka de Iinoni, better known by their international name Zutomayo (stylized as ZUTOMAYO), is a Japanese rock band under record label EMI Records Japan, affiliated with Watanabe Entertainment. 

The group is quite secretive by nature, seeing as they have never released a full member list, with each work crediting different people for their music production, lyrics, composition and arrangement. The only reoccurring member is the vocalist, who is only known as an unindentified woman going by the stage name "ACA-NE" (pronounced Akane). It can additionally be noted that their secrecy is a contributing factor to their popularity.

__Biography:__
Zutomayo debuted by releasing their first song "Byoushin wo Kamu" on YouTube on June 4, 2018. The song became an immediate hit on release, garnering 200,000 views within its first week on the platform. Additionally, after releasing the single through streaming platforms on August 30, the song became the most streamed song that week. Following their song's release, Zutomayo held their first concert at the Daikanyama Loop in Tokyo. Attendees were handed opaque glasses and reported that the entire venue was dark for the duration of the concert. The group would continue to conceal their identities in future concerts as well.

Zutomayo released two more singles digitally before releasing their first EP, Tadashii Itsuwari Kara no Kishou, on November 14 in the same year, through record label EMI Records Japan. The EP peaked 8th on the Oricon Albums Chart and was nominated in the 19th CD Shop Awards. On June 5, 2019, a second EP was released titled Imawa Imade Chikaiwa Emide, which peaked at the number one spot on the Oricon chart. Later in that same year on October 30, they would release their first full-length album titled Hisohiso Banashi.

__Members:__
- [ACA-NE](https://anilist.co/staff/170316/ACANE) (ACAね, Akane) – vocalist, in-charge of lyrics and composition

(Source: [Wikipedia (JP)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E3%81%9A%E3%81%A3%E3%81%A8%E7%9C%9F%E5%A4%9C%E4%B8%AD%E3%81%A7%E3%81%84%E3%81%84%E3%81%AE%E3%81%AB%E3%80%82), edited)

__Kawasemi__ is a Japanese animator, character designer and illustrator.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/zutomayo)

ACA-NE, alternatively pronounced as Akane, is a Japanese vocalist, lyricist, composer and member of the rock band [Zutomayo](https://anilist.co/staff/170315/ZUTOMAYO).

__Rino Yumenosaki__, better known as Yumenosaki, is a Japanese animator, character designer and illustrator.

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/deguchi0220)__

__Ryou Deguchi__ is a Japanese bassist, lyricist, composer and arranger.

__Graduated:__ Ritsumeikan University (Department of Science and Engineering)

__[Website](https://colorfulwave.wixsite.com/colorfulwave) | [Profile (Love Annex)](https://love-annex.jp/creators/%E9%BB%92%E5%B7%9D%E9%99%BD%E4%BB%8B/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/kurokawa_cafe)__

__Yousuke Kurokawa__ is a Japanese composer and arranger.

__[Profile (Tunecore)](https://www.tunecore.co.jp/artist?id=183922)__

__Introduction:__
Art Neco is a Japanese music production duo consisting of Miku and Homi.

__Members:__
- [Miku](https://twitter.com/mktorry) (美孔) – vocalist and in-charge of composition, also does art
- [Homi](https://twitter.com/Homi_Art_Neco) (鳳神) – guitarist, drummer, in-charge of composition and arrangement

__Graduated:__ Saitama Kenritsu Inagakuensogokoto School

__[Website](http://nishimuranao.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/nyaoyan1008) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/nyaoyan1008)__

__Nao Nishimura__ is a Japanese keyboardist and pianist.

[Website](https://junmurayama.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/jun_murayama)

__Introduction:__
Jun Murayama is a Japanese musician, known for doing music composition and arrangement, while also being a music producer, pianist and keyboardist. He is also a member of the bands Venomstrip and FLOWER FLOWER.

__Biography:__
He started playing the piano at the age of three, then later on as a third year college student, he started his professional career after being scouted by the Light Music Club. Following this he joined [Koichi Domoto's](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Koichi_Domoto) tour, whom he knew from college.

He's mostly known as the keyboardist to the four-piece rock band FLOWER FLOWER with the stage name mura☆jun, which he joined in 2013. In the band his name was mistakenly introduced as 松潤 (Matsujun) when referring to members, so  instead of his actual stage name mura☆jun the fans have nicknamed him as such.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/yotchitchi)

Yoshihiro Kawamura, better known as Yotchi, is a Japanese drummer and member of the bands [Botchan](https://twitter.com/botchan_info) and [The Snorks](https://twitter.com/snorks_official). 

He is the son of [Noriyasu Kawamura](https://anilist.co/staff/285742), who is also a drummer.

[Profile (Being Creators)](https://beingcreators.net/p_nikamoto/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/chan_nika116) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/ryosuke.nikamoto)

Ryousuke Nikamoto is a Japanese bassist affiliated with the private entertainment conglomerate Being.

__[Blog (JP)](https://ameblo.jp/taka-snow-guitar) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/kojiro_guitar)__

__Takayuki Sasaki__, better known as Takayuki "Kojiro" Sasaki, is a Japanese guitarist, violinist, composer and arranger.

__Residency:__ Tokyo, Japan

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/torumatake)

Tooru Matake is a Japanese recording and mixing engineer.

__Residency:__ Meguro Ward, Tokyo, Japan
__Graduated:__ Toho Gakuen

Kouhei Matsumoto is a Japanese sound producer.
